title: G-Force Impact
description: Drivers experience forces over 5G during sharp turns
detail: During heavy braking and cornering, F1 drivers can experience forces up to 6G, making their body feel 6 times heavier than normal.

title: Pit Stop Speed
description: Pit crews can change all four tires in under 2 seconds
detail: The current world record for a pit stop is 1.82 seconds, achieved by Red Bull Racing. This requires perfect coordination from 20+ team members.

title: Steering Complexity
description: Steering wheels have 20+ buttons and controls
detail: Modern F1 steering wheels cost over $50,000 and contain more computing power than the first space shuttles.

title: Training Intensity
description: Drivers train 6-8 hours daily on simulators
detail: F1 drivers combine physical fitness, mental preparation, and simulator work to maintain reaction times faster than fighter pilots.

title: Hybrid Power
description: Cars produce over 1000 horsepower with hybrid tech
detail: Modern F1 cars combine a 1.6L V6 turbo engine with advanced energy recovery systems for maximum efficiency and power.

title: Precision Engineering
description: Engines rev to 15,000 RPM with millimeter precision
detail: F1 engines are rebuilt after every race, with components machined to tolerances smaller than human hair thickness.
